intro: Euphorbia hieroglyphica, commonly known as the Egyptian Spurge, is a succulent plant native to the deserts of Egypt and Sudan. It is characterized by its distinctive, branching structure and spiny, fleshy stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Its thick, waxy leaves help reduce water loss, and it has a deep root system to access underground moisture. Euphorbia hieroglyphica is often used in xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and unique appearance.
